name: NPR
text:
Colleges across the U.S. are worried about coronavirus outbreaks in the fall. Their plans to prevent the spread all rely on one thing: students following the rules.

But some experts fear that's too big of a risk.
https://t.co/90z9OpGzD6

name: NPR
text:
Want to be happier? @NPRLifeKit has some expert tips on how to cultivate gratitude and reframe positive thinking, including:

üåªlist what you‚Äôre grateful for
‚ú®express gratitude for others
üå±complaining may feel good, but it doesn't make you happier
https://t.co/bZltcFcNtl

name: NPR
text:
Statues of Christopher Columbus are being toppled or removed across the country. Now, that movement is playing out in Columbus, Ohio ‚Äî the city named for him.
https://t.co/z9JAJn8Ieq

name: NPR
text:
Reddit has banned the subreddit "The_Donald," a forum for President Trump fans with nearly 800,000 users, saying it repeatedly violated the platform's rules against harassment, hate speech and content manipulation.
https://t.co/FJweRdbp6n

name: NPR
text:
Patience and Fortitude, the marble lions perched outside the New York Public Library, have been given face coverings ‚Äî a reminder to New Yorkers to follow COVID-19 safety guidelines.
https://t.co/VijsR8ilcZ

name: NPR
text:
Sen. Mitch McConnell: "We must have no stigma, none, about wearing masks when we leave our homes and come near other people. Wearing simple face coverings is not about protecting ourselves. It is about protecting everyone we encounter."
https://t.co/Pa3HYXCv4L

name: NPR
text:
Arizona Gov. Doug Ducey has ordered bars, gyms, movie theaters and water parks to shut down for at least 30 days amid thousands of new coronavirus cases in the state.
https://t.co/UEKdj66ofB

name: NPR
text:
New daily coronavirus cases are rising in 38 states, an NPR analysis shows. 

Here's how much cases are up compared to 2 weeks ago:

üìà Idaho: +408%
üìà Florida: +277%
üìà Texas: +184%
üìà Nevada: +156%
üìà Arizona: +145%
https://t.co/3OfWBtYjJz

name: NPR
text:
Reddit is banning some 2,000 subreddits ‚Äî including "The_Donald," the forum for diehard Trump fans, and the left-learning "Chapo Trap House" ‚Äî as part of an update to its hate speech policies.
https://t.co/Fo44gCIKMf

name: NPR
text:
Mississippi lawmakers on Sunday voted to retire the state's flag with the Confederate battle emblem in the corner, which has flown since 1894. "It was a very hateful oppressive and divisive symbol," says Sen. Derrick Simmons.
https://t.co/Gks1osqkKl

name: NPR
text:
Gov. Andrew Cuomo on Monday announced New York's lowest number of hospitalizations and average coronavirus death toll since the pandemic began.

New cases, however, are on the rise in other parts of the U.S.
https://t.co/OsqlcChTBq

name: NPR
text: The controversial security law, which could effectively criminalize most dissent in the city, will likely take effect on July 1, which is also the anniversary of Hong Kong's 1997 handover from British to Chinese rule. https://t.co/ASHcNqkpCH

name: NPR
text:
Two senators are calling for an investigation of 5 states that ordered nursing homes to accept COVID-19-positive patients who were discharged from hospitals.
https://t.co/a8ABN1xBTB

name: NPR
text:
World Health Organization chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus: "We all want this to be over. We all want to get on with our lives. But the hard reality is this is not even close to being over."
https://t.co/GXsP3DCcj4

name: NPR
text:
Minnesota Attorney General Keith Ellison is suing Exxon Mobil, Koch Industries and the American Petroleum Institute over what he calls "a campaign of deception" about climate change.
https://t.co/HtlF1s0IW7

name: NPR
text:
Iran has issued arrest warrants for 3 dozen U.S. officials ‚Äî including President Trump ‚Äî for the U.S. assassination of Iran's Gen. Qassem Soleimani in January. Trump faces little threat of being arrested.
https://t.co/4SQBRULJ0S

name: NPR
text:
The San Jose Police Dept. has put 4 officers on administrative leave as it investigates allegations that current and retired officers posted racist and Islamophobic messages in a private Facebook group, including "I say re-purpose the hijabs into nooses."
https://t.co/qWzS65xm4e

name: NPR
text:
Carmen is an essential worker at a warehouse that ships N95 masks. When she started showing symptoms in March, she went to her doctor, and then to the ER, to try to get tested for COVID-19.

She didn't get a test ‚Äî but ended up with a bill for $1,840.
https://t.co/FzpGZEBRiJ

name: NPR
text:
A new NPR/Harvard analysis finds that 18 states plus D.C. are currently doing enough testing to keep their outbreaks under control.

But most states are still falling short of what's needed to beat back the pandemic.

Find out how your state is doing ‚¨áÔ∏è
https://t.co/oaKhCkIGbS

name: NPR
text:
Months ahead of the election, a federal appeals court in Wisconsin has reaffirmed voting restrictions favored by Republicans‚Äîfinding in favor of limits on early voting and restoring a rule that residents must live in a district for 28 days to vote there.
https://t.co/XZsU22UN7R

name: NPR
text: WATCH LIVE: Senate Health Committee discusses plans for reopening schools and offices. https://t.co/KlnwU9nVU8

name: NPR
text:
The European Union will bar U.S. travelers from visiting when it opens its external borders on July 1. The decision comes as the U.S. continues to grapple with surging coronavirus cases.
https://t.co/tvQ4bHHOBN

name: NPR
text: BREAKING: The Supreme Court has ruled that Montana‚Äôs exclusion of religious schools from a state scholarship progra‚Ä¶ https://t.co/vHBtczj35E

name: NPR
text:
The Senate Committee on Health, Education, Labor and Pensions is discussing plans today for reopening schools and work offices that have been shuttered during the pandemic.

Watch the hearing live ‚¨áÔ∏è
https://t.co/HpGHqSlpFE

name: NPR
text:
The decision is a victory for parents who wanted to use the state tax credit to help send their kids to religious schools.

Read more: https://t.co/pWp5IsoPbA

name: NPR
text:
Robert Fuller was found hanging from a tree in Palmdale, Calif., this month. Many are skeptical his death was a suicide.

For decades, neo-Nazis and skinheads have been a threat in the area‚Äîlinked to hate crimes including the firebombing of a Black church.
https://t.co/PYTHG8vnYk

name: NPR
text:
A statement endorsed by more than 300 college admissions deans says they recognize students may be struggling ‚Äî and that they won't be disadvantaged by not participating in extracurricular activities right now.
https://t.co/tEhoRthJpV

name: NPR
text: Sen. Rand Paul accused Dr. Anthony Fauci and others of focusing too much on the risks at a Senate hearing on COVID-‚Ä¶ https://t.co/V9hRotsdqW

name: NPR
text:
Amy McGrath has beaten progressive Charles Booker in Kentucky's high-profile Senate primary, The AP projects. She will now face Republican Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell.
https://t.co/Ur14CTY2Ez

name: NPR
text:
The police department in Aurora, Colo., is investigating several officers who posed for photos at a memorial site for Elijah McClain ‚Äî near where he was forcibly arrested last summer.

The officers are on administrative leave with pay.
 https://t.co/c4FFTR9BOU

name: NPR
text:
South Korea has acknowledged it is permanently keeping data on patients from a previous epidemic of MERS in 2015 ‚Äî raising concerns from privacy advocates.
https://t.co/m0FijuVR3F

name: NPR
text:
The former Atlanta police officer accused of murdering Rayshard Brooks is appearing before a judge today. He is expected to ask the judge to release him from jail on bond while his case is pending.
https://t.co/MRUCONyhKE

name: NPR
text:
The NAACP plans to relocate its headquarters from Baltimore to Washington, D.C.

The organization's president, Derrick Johnson, says it will allow the group to "amplify the voices of the Black people as we fight for the crucial policy changes."
https://t.co/O1LwjMEL6q

name: NPR
text:
Sufjan Stevens has announced a new album ‚Äî 'The Ascension' ‚Äî out Sept. 25. It will be his eighth solo studio album and his first since 2015.

The first single will be released this Friday.
https://t.co/FnszGK7K4T

name: NPR
text: Comedian Nicole Byer talks to @NPRitsbeenamin host Sam Sanders  about what it was like to make her new book ‚Äú#VeryFat #VeryBrave,‚Äù what it taught her about her body, and why the store Lane Bryant touches a nerve https://t.co/cisg7PpWwI

name: NPR
text:
A new study finds that roughly half of the entire American workforce is now remote.

One economist says he thinks some companies are realizing remote work isn't as daunting as they had imagined ‚Äî and that this "portends a much bigger shift in the economy."
https://t.co/1jcqJOxUvj

name: NPR
text:
Freddy Cole died on Saturday at the age of 88. With his charming, easeful baritone and a crisp, efficient touch at the piano, he carved out a distinguished career of more than 65 years.
https://t.co/zQzCUp5B8p
